alert.note: Alert for Western Pendleton (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 14 at 2:35PM EST until January 15 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EST MONDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 1 PM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations around 1 to 3 inches. * WHERE...Western Pendleton County. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 4 AM EST Monday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from midnight tonight to 1 PM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The combination of cold temperatures and accumulating snow will cause hazardous conditions for the Monday morning commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
